_ad6WTgKW3IXShNI5xQToA.text: I just ate here after reading about it online and I'm disappointed... with how much money I spent. The food is good, and the atmosphere is hip, but holy ****, I just spent $35 on 4 meager pieces of chicken, A scoop of gourmet Mac n cheese, some pickled green beans that I didn't eat, and some delicious okra. I was so shocked by how little food we got, that I practically interrogated the server when she dropped off the food. "THIS is a meal for two?" I asked. "Yes." she replied. "This is the whole order? Like... everything?" I responded. She clearly saw the sincere disappointment in my eyes and brought me additional food (without me asking) which was nice of her. Anyway, I think you're paying an unnecessary "trend tax" by eating here; it's a cool place in Lawrenceville with subway tile walls and an exposed support beam ceiling, but damn... the chicken wasn't even THAT good. I could've gotten just as much food at Union for half the price.

5UyNHs8mOxoIWIK7WfmTTQ.text: The star I gave is for the cute building, which was the only good thing about my experience.  We were given lukewarm water to start. The menu doesn't offer many choices so don't bring anyone who isn't ready to try different things. I had the salad, and for ten dollars thought it would be enough for a light lunch.  It was tiny and full of inedible greens.  I enjoy different lettuces, but these were greens that needed to be sauteed. They were rough and bitter.  There were about three green beans and one or two potatoes. The dressing was straight up vinegar. My mother had the polenta which contained one egg, a blossom of some sort and two sprigs of basil. For $13.  There was no bread, and once the plates were dropped off, no one came back to our table.  Because of the bitterness, I only ate the beans and potatoes out of my salad and my mother also only ate half, yet no one bothered to see if we liked our meal.  In fact, we had to flag down our waitress for the check only to be told to pay at the counter.  I would recommend many of the other places in Lawrenceville, which is what I wish I would have done.

ygCk85Sw7xirUhkm3kTO_Q.text: Delicious burger and fries with a nice, easygoing vibe. Service was awesome...took time to explain interesting menu options.

b0wnpj10ad1GBU96ObP4Ag.text: Picture this - Black Friday, a buddy and I have a bottle of the famed Bourbon County barleywine and a bottle of Dogfish 120 Minute.  Now add to this situation that it's 11AM and that most places have funky hours because apparently Black Friday is a national holiday now.  We NEED  a spot to rip into these beers AND eat some great food.  We stumbled into The Vandal after unsuccessful adventures to other establishments and were instantly greeted with menus and glasses for our sumptuous beers.  While we savored our first sips, we both selected the fried chicken sandwich (how can you not? my God it was big and just looks like it belongs in the Guggenheim) - I got a side of the mac and cheese and my friend got the (very large) side of fries.  The sandwiches come on a bed of greens and a small drizzle of dressing - everything was so fresh.  I didn't feel gross about eating a fried chicken sandwich and left with a happy stomach and empty beer bottles.  This is an amazing BYO place that is simple yet refined.  It does have a hipster vibe since it's set in the hipster capital of Pittsburgh, but that is NOT a bad thing.  I will definitely go back to try some of their other menu items because they have much more refined options that would be better served with a bottle of wine.  Well done, Vandals!

uKFwkmrJSLCAP14arO4Nfw.text: Excellent place! We had a terrific dinner and that night the restaurant was donating a share of the proceeds to charity. Eating good and doing good, an excellent combination.

8w7d9conT6R6ZcL2W9c-nw.text: Stopped in around 840 on a Saturday night and was lucky to get a seat.  Had the cured trout crepes for an appetizer, they were excellent and got the burger and fries for dinner, excellent as well.  The atmosphere was great and I cannot say enough about the service.  They were friendly and genuine but not over bearing or too much in your face.   I will definitely go back.

XgGEs2ssHUHpNxXpJnGnuA.text: The trout dish was delicious. I highly recommend it. Staff were very friendly and pleasant.

O0HvBD5QmZFBUFm2HPKZBA.text: Great food, atmosphere, and service. The wife and I have been going here since it opened, and it just keeps getting better.

4KL_wpsEumvaWis6SpY0ag.text: Being a vegetarian, I was so excited to find out they had options on their menu. The eggplant sandwich was amazing! The fries and Mac and Cheese were also delicious. It was a relaxed atmosphere with perfectly sized portions. I will be returning!

745YsloDcOKtvcj84dBCxg.text: Great, great place. Super low-key but everything tastes (and looks) great. Their chef team is awesome.

FY9xhsmtUXEdJmhCkeUdkQ.text: Favorite pgh restaurant. Small, inventive menu done perfectly. Wonderful fresh salads, creative pastas, delicious mains. Also, byob, which makes it the cheapest excellent meal around.

N9xxCd4utxZwbhX7gxPgJg.text: If you are looking for a place to cater, based on our experience I highly do not recommend. Vandal catered an awards dinner we attended last night, and it was terrible. First, something happened to the truck, so there was no salad. The offerings were two large bowls of cold mac and cheese, and two platters of sandwiches. I chose the pulled beef slider with mustard and it would have been good, but the bun was soaked and again, the food was cold. My friend chose the roasted carrot sandwich and said it was terrible. There were no other sides or choices. It was a shame and totally diminished the event. ONE bright spot, there was a lovely lemonade drink that was delicious!

Gy0NMQrq0sRNGqFHI4KlsA.text: Just popped in here for brunch, after having driven past hundreds of time. Had the soft scramble, which was pretty much perfect in every way. Great atmosphere, very friendly staff; this place is a winner in every respect!

8MXhS7XvTDLS7mhQudfWzA.text: Unbelievable. Look no further for brunch. Started with the ricotta toast. Off the charts. A perfect egg followed and the bacon is on the list of best ever.  I eat a lot of breakfast around the world and this place more than holds its own.

aj9O-rqxjgzTT3NdqAPuTg.text: I have been wanting to come in here for a while. Finally got the chance tonight.  I wasn't disappointed. I got the pork sandwich and it was very good.  I was skeptical at first based on the ingredients, but they all worked very well together.  My only complaint was that the toasted bread it came on was a little greasy.  But that mDe it taste better. I will be back to try other things!

s_wzeyHt-ryj8UQi_5t_2A.text: My boyfriend and I went to Vandal for breakfast over the holidays. We both got the egg and bacon biscuit and the food was great - you can tell that it's all quality ingredients. The restaurant is also beautiful and full of light. I just got takeout this morning and it was a similar, great experience. The staff is also extremely hospitable. I'll definitely be back!

QsKvzs_fuzS_xzbXyw8Cyg.text: The vandal has fresh, innovative food, a friendly staff and a great atmosphere. It's consistently good and they always have something new or different on the menu. I especially recommend the ham biscuit for brunch. It's breakfast sandwich nirvana!

5sChlICKTcRq_0YYf_XTJQ.text: Went to vandal because we needed something quick to eat after Christmas shopping in lawrenceville and glad we did.  Food was top notch and it's clear the chef is classically trained. Chic food on paper plates is the best way to describe it.  They also had the best lavender tea I've ever had. It's byob and order at the counter but it's definitely worth a stop in. I hope they keep the food as the star and stay away from the trap of becoming a bar.  The only reason I give it a four is we went late and they ran out of a couple menu items.

IQk3AWKGC9E2jvgkaLJs7A.text: We had breakfast here this morning. I had the ham biscuit and my husband had the yogurt. Both were presenting amazingly and tasted soooo good. We cannot wait to come back to see what they have for lunch and dinner!

cLEmonHj_qxrTHD2E-pdlQ.text: Stopped in after work. Loved the space it made the designer in me happy and the pork sandwich was fresh and tasty.

MArecmN9wl3vlvWr2jgmKg.text: Had an excellent breakfast today! Soft ricotta scramble and biscuit sandwich were outstanding. We contemplated the beignets, but didn't go that route; however, we may have missed out because they looked awesome!!!! Portions were great and the house brew coffee was really great too. We loved the atmosphere and the staff was pleasant. Had to grab 2 lattes on the way out. Will definitely be back - make the trip to Lawrenceville to Vandel. Well worth it!

DIh290JNzPYkJ_JjQRSJcg.text: I had lunch at the Vandal in May and had a good experience. I wanted to try the breakfast menu on a Sunday morning. My son gave his name and number and was told 30-35 min. We walked around for 45min and I stopped by to ask how much longer. I was told we are next but at least 20 more min. After 2.5 hours I called to ask if it's still a reasonable wait time. The lady that answered gave the phone to a gentleman that said he tried to call and wanted to talk to my son because I sounded combative when I was talking to him. To my son he said he put his number in the garbage so he can't confirm the number he called, and gave him a number to call next time to make reservation. There are many good restaurants in the area with excellent customer service, no one needs to wait a whole morning for a meal reservation only to find out his number ended up in the garbage and being told they are combative when they ask why they were not called. Spend your money at a place that cares about customers.

zacyndfZVEFoTzuWGbb3Ew.text: This place is awesome. Fresh, simple menu is absolutely delightful. Current favorite on the menu is the eggplant dish but the guacamole toast and the biscuit--available for breakfast--are both phenomenal. Staff is friendly and helpful and the space is a big ol' breathe of fresh air. Great spot to grab yummy food with good friends. Done deal.

WbOOCH0n1XhNsLhDSp0Ppw.text: This is hands down the best french toast I've ever had. The bread was light and fluffy and had a nice crips on the outside. It was topped with lemon curd, raspberry jam and basil. Basil! Who would've thought an herb would compliment this dish so nicely but it does. The basil pairs really well with the lemon curd. The french toast came with syrup however I did not need it at all. In fact, I didn't even realize that I could put syrup on top until I finished my meal lol. I also had a side of the frites with the black garlic aioli. The sauce was to DIE for and the fries were cooked just how I like them. If you're looking for a nice, bougie brunch spot, this is definitely the place to go. It also has a beautiful aesthetic inside and the prices are not that expensive. This place is a win win win!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French Toast

7uGc8uMrbslRvkHQbXdMjQ.text: After a disappointing stroll through busy and over crowded Lawrenceville on a Saturday night, we had lost hope in this trendy area. However, The Vandal was kind enough to let us dine with them without a reservation.   The best way to describe our experience was 'under control'. From delicious appetizers, to my request for an espresso drink, The Vandal provided us an excellent meal and dining experience.   For dinner, we started with the bread service , tempura cauliflower and then shared the pork Milanese with was out of this world!  Next time I'll at least know to make a reservation... but really appreciated the owner squeezing us in.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork Milanese

eztm9CLzpU7aBLi5FFAp5g.text: You guys. The Vandal is such a gem.   My boyfriend and I stopped in for breakfast when we were passing through Pittsburgh and we were not disappointed! I had the ricotta soft scrambled eggs (life changing!) and he had the purple corn pancakes (also wonderful!). We also shared a pecan roll before we left since everything is made in house and I couldn't pass it up!   Also, the interior is very cute and open. I loved all of the natural light!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pecan roll with butter. I thought the butter was frosting and was certainly surprised when I took a bit forkful and ate it!
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ricotta soft scrambled eggs!
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Purple corn pancakes with a side of bacon!

glTNnsBmgkYcAVStjP2voA.text: The Vandal is a great little spot, but we had a very mixed experience during restaurant week. I showed up on the dot of our reservation time. Our table was not quite ready so I waited. My bf was looking for parking. I knew then the trouble was going to begin. The host was testy with me. I tried to be friendly but no luck. When he finally seated me, I asked for a glass of wine. He got even more testy with me, bordering on downright rude, telling me that my dining companion was not there and other BS. WTF?! Luckily once my bf arrived and dinner service was underway all else went smoothly. Our server was LOVELY, and the food was excellent. A great little spot, but the host has GOT TO GO. He was horrific and rude to me and almost ruined the whole night. If not for this experience with him this place would be a solid 4 stars.

vgJ8CLjDp2NAGb0Uoo-Wnw.text: One of my favorite restaurants of all time. I make it a point to come here every chance I'm in Lawrenceville due to the fact that not only is their menu is always changing (and they have separate breakfast,lunch, and dinner menus which I love), but they are consistently surprising me with the dishes and flavors they come up with! The chefs pay attention to the smallest details which make the food worth wild. I also am amazingly shocked with pricing of their food. So affordable for reasonable portions, I honestly thought it would be more expensive but my check has never been more than $30 (unless I'm getting drinks). I recommend this to anyone and everyone, they have very simple great creations as well as dishes I would have never thought to try. I think there is something for everyone here with their large variety of options and open-mindedness when it comes to their menu!!

EoXSAN1uGbwidrQEFy25lQ.text: Breakfast if in Lawrenceville at this place is a must!!! We wanted to eat everything on the menu. If you have 4 people you can get close.   First the decor, lovely white wash brick and minimalist styling on the tables was quite inviting. Service was quick and ultimately friendly.  We started wth a rhubarb muffin with wonderful jam and pecan roll for the table. Omg delicious buttery goodness. Had the smoked trout with potato latkes that were presented in a surprising format and so sooo good. Pierogies stuffed purple potatoes accompanied  pork sausage. I only tried the pierogies and DAMN! There's the requisite BEC on a biscuit. That biscuit; heavenly. Last but not least the short stack of blue corn pancakes. Oh were those good too! Yes. Really liked the space, food and company.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Short stack with 2 sides... bacon and 1 egg.
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked trout on latke with a pickled egg. OMG
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So cute and no wait!!

uzLcwqzyeYAe6RQvEeUpyQ.text: Locally sourced, creative, delicious dining.  Executive Chef, Csilla Thackray, certainly got the job done with her all woman crew. We ordered everything vegetarian from the menu and we were delighted with all of our choices.   If you are a foodie, get here quick, there's lots to appreciate and enjoy.   Our service was excellent and the arrival of the courses was perfectly paced.  A $5 corkage for the wine seemed reasonable, it's a little less for beer.   Overall, an excellent meal and we will be back again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. pistachio custard, rose creme, salted pistachio
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Candy plate.chocolate truffle, blood orange pate de fruit, marshmellow, salted carmel
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. scarpinocc, ricotta, fines herbs, beurre monte, radish, verjus

QtQXRxRm00tasQy9obT-DA.text: I hate when I feel like I'm alone in the Yelp community in my reviews. But this was a miss for me. Came in for brunch on a Sunday with my brother and cousin. When we first walked in, let me tell you I did not feel welcome. The girls working the cafe area that seat you just really weren't welcoming.   Whatever so we sit down and order drinks. My chai was literally just a step above cold. But not warm. Tasted fine though.   Food: My cousin just wanted a couple eggs, no toast, no "salad" (as they call it) just 2 scrambled eggs. Waitress said they can't do that because the chef likes to stick to the menu. Lady, this is a $13 brunch restaurant not a 5 Michelin Star spot. She then said that could take a me y item and completely deconstruct it though and completely change a menu item, but not just give 2 eggs. Again, COME ON.   Ok so let's review the actual food. My fried chicken sandwich was super dry. I will say that since my cousin had to get a meal and got the ricotta scramble, those were really delightful. My brother got the duck and said he liked that also. Back to this salad though, salad is $2 and it's literally 5 pieces of greens. Mmmmmkkkkkk.   Anyways, I have been trying to make it to Vandal for about a year, so I was pretty disappointed and don't need to be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried chicken, pretty dry. And the side &#34;salad&#34;
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs and toast were bomb
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Duck

edBtwAz5FnesTfcNKUsjxw.text: The vandal is a very nice place, with a really calm and romantic ambience. The waitress was very welcoming and seated us immediately. The menu had limited items, but each of the dishes were worth it. We ordered the English Pea Ragout and the Sundance Carbonara. They were really delicious. In desserts, we ordered both the buttermilk pie and the tiramisu. They were exceptionally good and left you longing for more. We left with a content belly and a big smile on our faces. Definitely would return here. But yes, the place is a tad bit expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buttermilk Pie
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tiramisu

XFinIYkGNpnSlkyle_yGJg.text: Awesome. Food was unique and delicious. Great staff. Coffee also great.  Will be going back for sure, hopefully soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

BOgvUG_0EgAAWgQXelXeaw.text: Fantastic food, fantastic drinks, fantastic wait staff. We also loved the details in the decor, the clean and stylish bathroom, and the fact that they will take your number while you walk around the block, and can you when your table is ready. I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

H61lG9Y-P5tFvhLHkuvWuQ.text: Awesome breakfast spot. Love the fried chick sandwich, petite salad, pear chia pudding. I found out that menu changes from time to time. So, it looks like there are some regular items stays on the menu such as fried chicken sandwich, there are also some newer creative dishes will come and go. I like the concept that we can always come back to get something that we know we would love, also be able to try some new dishes in the place that we trust that will always serve you the most delicious  dish possible.

poULKiQkqY7V5WyvzVFWoQ.text: We came in early on a Sunday morning (just a wee bit past 9) for bunch. There were four other groups seated, so several spots still open. We were seated right by the door, not optimal when there were other tables against the wall and further away from the door. (This morning it was barely 10 degrees out.) They seated the next two pairs in the open spot, near the wall. Strange we didn't get that offer.  We placed an order for a chicken sandwich and duck hash. It arrives in a timely fashion. The chicken sandwich is tasty, with a nice balance of sweetness from the honey. The duck hash was okay and liked the sweet potatoes in lieu of regular potatoes. The portions was were rather small and the hash needed some salt and pepper.  Here is where I knock of stars. We wanted ketchup and salt and pepper, but couldn't seem to flag a waitress. I tried multiple attempts, even saying "excuse me" twice and didn't get so much as a blink in my direction. We had given up when I caught the eye of the barista and mouthed the condiments request. He promptly brought it over.   We were heading out and the waitress ask if we needed a physical receipt. Strange question. No, we responded. We were told it's okay to pay up front. We did and now I see what she meant. You don't even see an itemized receipt at all, just the total. From a customer perspective, not great as you might want to review before paying should there be a mistake or question.  Anyhoos, food is good (though relatively pricey) that we'll come back, but only in warmer weather. The number of people opening the door in/out left our food cold fast.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken sandwich, sizeable piece of chicken and nice balance of sweetness from the honey.
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Duck hash, small portion needed some salt and pepper. Otherwise, solid choice.

bgFrpj3Cx5luQskMPHUUPQ.text: Today I ate probably the best quiche I've ever eaten. It was so light and airy and the flavor was amazing. The crust was flaky and light and cooked wonderfully. The coffee was also really good!  I'll definitely be back to try their lunch or dinner menus.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. onion and leek quiche with goat cheese 5/5 stars; $12

PnzgCN86HEW5wc01cuurWA.text: Very quaint cafe with a great aesthetic. I ordered the smoked trout & really enjoyed it! The portion size was pretty average. The coffee was great & came  in a large portion. They ferment their own hot sauce which was very yummy with eggs. I will most likely return, but i do wish they had a larger menu selection.

cSibRpKU7YGi1aegGFyNmQ.text: Came here for brunch today. So so soooo good.  I had the biscuit with ham and egg.  This place is BYOB so I also had some pink champagne on the side.  My sandwich was SO good. The service was quick and the place is really clean.  It is very small but we came at 10:30am and had no problem getting a table.  Would definitely come back!

qphZViUzqbXjG8Qy_oZ4wA.text: My boyfriend and I visited on Sunday morning while in town for a short weekend get-a-way. We stayed in an Air bnb right down the street and kept walking past this place all weekend so we got here early for breakfast before leaving.   The atmosphere is very trendy; I wanted to steal all the decor for my own house and the coffee was great. The menu has very unique food items on it, we had to ask the server what a few things where but overall the food was good. My boyfriend and I actually ended up getting kind of sick after eating here, I'm not sure if it was from this place or what but it's worth noting.   The service was mediocre, this is the kind of trendy place where everyone working there seems too cool for anything and is really just there to boost the image of the place but it wasn't terrible.   There is also a super cute patio that would be just wonderful to enjoy breakfast on. I think this place is worth trying if you are in the mood for something very unique and trendy.

vpQU1inU1O-VfAfDxSc2YQ.text: My first visit to The Vandal was my second restaurant week stop and by far the best stop I have had in the years I have done restaurant week.  The Vandal did not disappoint.    I arrived a bit before my friend and they graciously brought bread to the table.  I'm not entirely sure if it was butter or cream cheese that they included with the bread - but whatever it was, it was amazing!  The Vandal offered 2 options for the 3 courses.  My friend and i decided to get both offerings and share so we could try more.  We also added the scallops off the regular menu.    Not a single item disappointed us.  From the radishes to the chocolate cake.  Everything was phenomenal.  My personal favorite dish was the extra dish we ordered - the scallops.  They were the best thing I have eaten in a long time.  They melted in your mouth, the presentation was amazing.  Just an amazingly put together dish.  The owner came and spoke to us before and after our meal.  He was engaging and grateful for folks coming to the restaurant.  Since they change the menu often to take advantage of whatever is fresh at the time - I plan to go back.  Many times.    Please go check it out.  They recently added dinner - and it is WELL worth ti.

mfVF0pzuXLFRlcjSmcuIxg.text: Environmental and atmosphere: 5 Star. Simple but attractive.  Service: 2 Star. Very short handed. They did not even brought us glass while we have a bottle of water. We waited for 10 mins for the bill and we had to stand up looking for  Food: 4 Star. Looks gorgeous and taste good.  Price: 5 Star. Reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Duck egg. A little bit greasy for me. But I really like the crispy bacon on it!
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. carpaccio. Really good!
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ocean Trout. Smell and taste like Salmon. Pretty good! The pink sauce is marvelous with a little hint of lemon.

KN0LXslrb9YW28Ifjr5SQg.text: Very small portions. I had a salad and the lettuce was gritty. Not sure if it was washed well. My daughter had a side of potatoes for brunch and they were not cooked well. Will not return.

GhGmkhv8s8iGe4LHD8feJw.text: There's "toast," and then there's TOAST.  Vandal's "Toasts" fall into the latter category. I arrived at The Vandal one sunny Sunday Lville morning with a crew of 6. We were seated right away and ordered from the counter after perusing the [small] menu. I chose the Huckleberry Toast while Aimee D. chose the Squash Toast so we could share.  Among the groups' other choices were the Morning Burger, a Bacon Plate and Celery Soup.  We all left pleased, but maybe just a tad bit hungry. The Toasts are INCREDIBLE, but at the end of the day, it's one [big] piece of toast. So, if you're looking for more, I'd recommend adding the yogurt/granola for some delicious protein. We were each given a sample of this concoction and DAMN, was it good.  But back to the toasts - the ingredients on top were clearly top notch. At $6, each Toast isn't going to break the bank, but $12 for two, which I definitely could've housed, is a bit too much for me for...toast. Something to think about. I recommend going with a bunch of friends and completely "vandalizing" the menu - meaning, order one of everything and have at it. Welcome to Lawrenceville, Vandal!

mqWAzCeGnTB22RzfHCY2Ag.text: We came to the restaurant exclusively for the burger, only to learn they were not serving it at dinner. The website lists the burger as an option for dinner, but it is a month out of date. We were served our beer in the bottles, they did not provide glasses. "Prawn" came with 4 pieces of shrimp, and over 20 peppers. We expected more shrimp, this dish should definitely be called "Peppers" When the main dishes came out, the NY Strip was cold. We had $10 corking fees which was not listed anywhere. Additionally,  there was no soap in the women's bathroom. Horrible experience.

fab0SPni_KNx3L6IMPNWSA.text: Never again. The owner, Joey, is very rude. I Wasn't feeling good (and it was cold out) and I knew my peppermint tea in my bag would make me feel better with my brunch... so I asked for hot water and I used my own tea bag (normally not something I do, actually never done before, but I ordered brunch too)... he flat out schooled me for bringing my tea. It was beyond shitty of him to do... he actually said to me "I'm trying to make a living here... it's common courtesy not to bring in your own food... you actually brought that? " I haven't had a guy talk to me like that... in the worst shitty tone in a very very long time... all he had to say was "hey next time I have tea here, hope u feel better" or say nothing at all. He tried to make up for it later with a complimentary rice pudding (which tasted way to sweet) but I was already pissed off and I was so embarrassed in front of my date. I've told almost everyone I know about this encounter- people who know him-- weren't surprised he acted that way. Too bad... especially for a new business owner. Karma.

XIAShv11FA6P8JUV3mU-Gw.text: This place is really overrated.  I rarely write reviews, but I felt so disappointed after going here that I was compelled to do so.  I got a eggplant wrap or sandwich or something for 10 or 11 bucks.  My wife and compatriots all got burgers.    Burger patties were dry, small, 4th of July dad burgers.  In other words, not very flavorful.  And at 10 bucks or whatever, RIDICULOUSLY overpriced.  For another 5 bucks you could get a burger at Salt, which was literally the best burger you could ever put in your mouth.  But, alas, they are closed.  Even burgatory/brgr/tessoros have way better burgers than this place if you are into shelling out over 10 bucks for a burger.  The Eggplant wrap was the worst though.  It wasn't even a wrap!  It was a freaking piece of pita bread with a pool of hummus and like 10 chunks of eggplant that were so-so.  Total ripoff.  The fries were good.  The staff was really nice and attentive.  And the decor was, of course, kewl.  Hopefully the food catches up to the hype at some point.

g8MfXcA8YyRvF0629P7tdA.text: Food is solid guys. It's local, it's thoughtful, it's nicely prepared, you'll enjoy it. But onto a more important matter. You spend your money on frivolous things; your cars, your distressed jeans, your $6 cup of coffee. That's cool, get what makes you happy. Dining out is a routine occurrence for some, an indulgence for others. Did you know that Joey donates a portion of his profits every Wednesday to a local cause? My friends and I have been going for months to support this endeavor. We are lucky to be able to enjoy each other's company in a cozy cafe with high quality food among like-minded patrons. If you are feeling hopeless, stressed, and questioning humanity...volunteer, be kind, be generous....and grab some friends and hit The Vandal on a Wednesday. It's cheaper than therapy.

d3Wpy0RxGq1GoIjJXxKBYw.text: The atmosphere and staff all deserve high compliments. The burgers we ordered however do not. The first set were under done. So were the second.  We were given a refund and all is forgiven.

iD_R2S1iBm6drKwXnrxt4Q.text: The Vandal menu is so simple yet the food is very complex. Tons of flavors going on with the Pork Sandwich on wonderful rye bread. The Chicken Sandwich is hearty, slaw-y, and yummy, but you'll need your napkin. Today I had the Burger, which was tastes and filling, but those fries man. Super hot and fresh, with just a dash of salt, oh so crispy. Heinz ketchup of course. Get to The Vandal, ya filthy vanimals!

SZgfC8SxH3nSMEb9auR2yg.text: The bone marrow burger was all juicy/savory/umami goodness.  Perfect balance between a caramelized exterior, perfectly seasoned and savory patty, and some nice pickled ramps that were a great foil to the richness of the burger.   I'll be back!

vYSSqxj8lDihJKUCWXOhCQ.text: A modern-hip eatery located in the heart of lawerenceville. The staff are very welcoming and chipper. The daily menu with different selections allows the consumer to try something new each time. Great vibes inside. Enough about the place more about the food. WOW. Perfectly cooked chicken. The pairings for the chicken with the ginger and slaw was to die for! Can't wait to return to try something new!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The chicken on the daily menu was phenomenal. Cooked to perfection!!! The ginger sauce made the sandwich. Can&#39;t wait to go back!

k30goCr1Oe0YXk6UiowvSA.text: So delighted this place is here! Easily one of my favorite places to grab a quick meal in Pittsburgh. Speaking only for vegetarian items, everything was delicious. The decor is perfect, in my opinion - light, minimal, airy, and modern - and the staff is friendly and acts as if you're a good friend they haven't seen in years. My one complaint is that it would be nice if there were a vegan option on the menu, or at least something that could be easily edited to be vegan.

lyh9eco0ZcG8ZfFwLMPkFQ.text: Came for Sunday brunch and enjoyed the food, atmosphere and service. The owner, Joey, was super nice and made it a point to stop by the table a bunch to see how everything was going and went above and beyond with the hospitality, by giving my family and I helpful tips on what to do in Pittsburgh during our stay. Maybe we are just jaded Brooklynites, but I would recommend, based on the welcoming feel and stellar service alone!

202AJfxdUg3wbYh1x4-rEw.text: Meh. I had the chicken sandwich ($10 with no side)  and beet salad ($4 for 2.5 beets). For the money, I was unimpressed. The fried chicken was dry, cut into four little pieces that kept falling off the bun. It had this sticky honey sauce that ended up all over my hands, and the slaw was just mostly raw carrots. The beets were good, just felt like a small portion. The space was really great, and it's BYOB. Probably won't be back though.

xHhnRgOune1x-5eb7ONInw.text: Each dish was incredible with an interesting balance of tastes, textures and color combinations.   We had a starter plate of garlic custard -- sounds strange but was wonderful -- more like the texture of a spread.   We then shared the polenta dish, a burger and an order of pork sausage & potatoes with fiddle ferns. Each dish was a mouthful of sumptuous flavors.   Finally, we got seated quickly and had attentive service.   I'll be back as soon as possible!

bpLe6mdD1Hyne2pxl2lweA.text: I was in the other week. My food was cold and the staff seemed overworked. The chefs  could Audibly be heard discussing customers. Overrated and expensive

JiSaWw3Od3FEmtHUSadSLQ.text: This restaurant seems to have matured some since its opening and I must say, I am very impressed. This time we went for dinner, expecting the same casual atmosphere as lunch, and we were surprised to find a high-end candle lit atmosphere. Immediately after ordering, a series of delightful hors d'oeuvre are brought out from the kitchen at rapid fire. Delicious and unique flavor combinations indicative of a very intelligent and creative chef. We are already in heaven by the time our meal comes out and suddenly it gets even better. The ravioli with mushrooms was divine! Beautiful complex flavors with wine, cream, fish eggs. Unbelievably good! We finished off with an order of the pickle tray because we were so impressed with one of the pickled hors d'oeuvres that we had to try a larger sampling. Devine again. The BYOB status puts it over the edge! You can bring your own wine! Next time we will bring a bottle. And our meal was somehow under $50! Plus our waiter was the actual owner and was very pleasant and patient to talk to. You can tell he cares a lot about his restaurant. So yeah, that's as good as it gets. I am bringing my parents here next time they are in town.

GN7DAEfAQNJoC00KjmP4Ow.text: I just can't say enough good things about our dining experience at the Vandal. Attentive, courteous and informative servers. Creative, tasty starters (chilled nettle soup, pickled vegetables tempura, Austrian cheese spread with red cabbage and rye toast points), delicious entrees (salmon with rutabaga risotto and parsnip puree with a delicate lemon-fish sauce; fall-from-the-bone chicken paprikash with just the right amount of seasonings) and an unusual but incredibly satisfying dessert (rice pudding with sea salt, apple jam and hazelnut brittle) in a clean, no-frills, open kitchen space. Our party of four couldn't have felt more welcomed or pleased with dinner at the Vandal. Kudos to the restaurant for serving such fresh, well-prepared and thoughtful dishes and for having such a great, unpretentious staff and setting. Not only will I eat here again but also will I recommend to other originally-from-the-burgh friends. Such a treat!

_pPXKne3UUS86BcPkvrF2A.text: I will be back! Now for review:  First off-they don't serve coffee in real mugs - only to go cups. At that moment I knew I wasn't going to be overjoyed at breakfast here. Number two-I asked for a biscuit on the side and was told they wouldn't sell me one because they only had enough for the expected number of biscuit dishes they would sell that day. I should now mention I was the only person in the place. For the important part - the coffee is good. I had the soft scramble and the eggs were cooked PERFECTLY! They were a bit salty but the ricotta toned it down. The toast was made with brown bread which makes my heart happy. I believe the owner was out and about and couldn't have been nicer. So really the only downside is the ordering and coffee cups - but I think that is more indicative of the brunch culture in Pittsburgh.

uvOoif7qNhgSz7uE5DTQCw.text: Nicest guy ever behind the counter (one of the owners?). These were the BEST french fries I have ever had. No lie. Small menu that packs a huge amount of flavor. Yummy burger. But those fries! Burger, burger, meat, meat. Go here.

iQWQj6OcnhOrx1S_9vL5Sg.text: Vandal is delicious! I've come here dozens of times since the restaurant's opening. The place has a very refreshing ambiance. My personal favorite is sitting by the window, where I get to a great view of Butler Street in Lawrenceville. I have not tried their coffee yet, but their lavender and rose tea are incredible. My only complaint is that the prices are a bit steep considering the portions.

NYvzq9tGzGigberKJvbOxQ.text: Fresh and local for sure the bacon was awesome and the egg was perfectly cooked. This place has great potential. My only gripe is price. I got iced coffee and a bacon egg biscuit and it cost 12 with tip. With that being said the whole biscuit sandwich was smaller than a baseball and it was $6. Haven't had lunch there but willing to try it!

v-06Vqo84wR8-lbT0jzbSg.text: *WOULD RECOMMEND*  This place screams AESTHETIC. When we went, we had only 30 minutes before they close down for a private event. They were nice enough to seat and make sure we received our food with plenty of time to eat before they close. The presentation was all an instahoe like me could ask me. Price was just a bit high for the amount of food we get but it was still good. Plus their menus are seasonal so there's so much to try!  *BRUNCH* I got their trout dish and it was pretty good! It came with some greens, pickled cucumbers, and fried potato pancakes. I wished the potato pancake had more flavor to it but the trout was very flavorful and fresh. Portions were just right for the meal.  *VERDICT* I will definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked Trout

pAwQE6bzZSyQb02D_QymhQ.text: We went a little before the brunch rush and got a table immediately. Parking in that area is hit or miss (usually miss) so take that into account if you're trying to get there by a certain time. The atmosphere was trendy and food was good. I wish there was a way to only dock a half star because I would give them a 4.5 if I could. I like my food seasoned, and it was. I wasn't a fan of the extra tablespoon of sea salt on top of either of our plates though. It might've just been an off day because everything else was great. We got: -soft scramble: perfect eggs -fontina Mac and cheese: so creamy and delicious but a little too heavy for 10 am. The leftovers were great for dinner.  -drip coffee: tasted good with and without cream, didn't have that burnt taste some restaurants that aren't just coffee shops have. If anyone's looking for it, they serve Parlor Coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fontina mac
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Drip
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Soft Scramble

TCP5Xvm8NttPcoCF0f-YNA.text: Went there for Saturday Brunch. Nice atmosphere and friendly staffs.   The Brunch is on the expensive side so expect to pay at least $40 plus for 2.  Soft Scrambled was pretty good. The egg was soft and buttery. The cheese blended very well with the egg. I like the side salad that came with it better than the scrambled itself. The dressing is refreshing  The crispy chicken/ Fried chicken add egg was good as well. I didn't taste too much flour and very well flavored. You really get a nice big piece of chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Soft Scramble and Fried Chicken

e-tzioOPG3O3C5NSdKdciQ.text: Cute, fun, and yum! In my opinion, this is one Pittsburgh's few "fun" brunch spots. They have a great ambiance and great food to match. They offer unique options with everything sweet and savory. I opted for an aperol spritz and the poached pear and shared some fries with friends. Everything was tasty, especially the fries.   Though the wait can be lengthy, it's worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

vOXd6ak74kPXuVesb87EYg.text: Small, cute brunch place! We (party of 2) went there for Sunday brunch at 11am and waited around 20min to be seated. I'm not a huge fish person, let alone a trout fan, but ordered the smoked trout after seeing the beautiful photos and reading the many positive reviews. Turns out, I made the right decision--the trout was delicious! I cleaned my plate. The cinnamon roll was medicore--beautiful visuals with frosting drizzled on top, but the inside was a bit dry. Wish there were more seating options for two, besides the window seats, and outdoor seating for those waiting to be seated.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cinnamon roll
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked Trout

VqRmvzppO9efN_jxtbvo1A.text: I've been coming here pretty much since they've opened. The menu goes through a lot of changes every season, and all I can say is that *everything* is very good. For brunch, the soft scramble is incredible. For dinner, any of the pastas or fish dishes have never disappointed.

i-d6-p1JQxQGP_pWurcYLA.text: The food is so wonderful here!! Everything tastes so fresh and delicious. I have never been disappointed with this restaurant. I haven't tried their dinner yet but for breakfast/lunch it's always a reliable choice. The poached pear is heavenly! I ate it so quickly. The dish was full of texture, flavor and the perfect amount of sweetness. Yum! The pork schnitzel was also very good all in its own way. It's is very crispy however, the meat is so tender. I was a big fan of both dishes.   The interior is very bright and inviting. I love the minimalism. It's the perfect place to take pictures of your food due to the natural lighting.   Unfortunately, the service was a little mediocre for me today. The woman that helped me was very cold and seemed disinterested in serving my friend and I. I'm hoping she was just having a bad day because I've never had bad service here before.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork Schnitzel
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Poached Pear

kmMDAAE957l0v-_s4_AZMg.text: We were driving around on a rainy Friday and decided to go in to The Vandal for brunch. We were the only customers who came in there for the entire time so it felt extra quiet!   The waiter was friendly and professional. Cappuccino and latte were great. We also ordered the soft scramble eggs which were delicious, and also the schnitzel which was quite dry.  Overall it's pretty expensive. Bill came out to just under $50. Debating if I might give it another try on a busier day when I'm back in Pittsburgh.

yWlPWD5bN9YkB8GVYuptwQ.text: This place came highly recommended for breakfast so we were excited to check this place out!  It is a pretty small location with only seating for about 30 people or so be prepared if you go during one of their busy times because you might have a wait time.   The food is well worth the wait though...it is yummy and super interesting. I ordered the smoked trout with latkes and pickles...so yummy! It was like an eggs Benedict without the Hollandaise sauce and poached eggs...it was really tasty.   My husband ordered the breakfast burger and he was very pleasantly surprised and satiated.   The only issue we had was with the service. We had ordered a coffee and chai tea when we first sat down but didn't get them until we asked for them when our food was brought out...the place was not busy when we were there, it was just an oversight but it definitely tainted the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked trout with latkes

u8QKOm698ncyXn5wpEJ93Q.text: Let's just say this would be a 5 star review if we didn't notice half way through the meal that my husband's coffee cup had lipstick on it... let's just say this will be something we check from now on regardless of where we go lol  What a cute spot for brunch!! First off, I am kind of obsessed with Lawrenceville, so that helps. But The Vandal is cute on the inside, not many tables so it is quaint, and has an open kitchen. We had to wait about 20 minutes on. Sunday morning at 11am which I thought was acceptable. It was worth the wait for sure.   We started with a cappuccino and a latte while we examined the menu and flipped through pictures of amazing food on Yelp    Everything we ordered was pretty much perfect, save for the breakfast burger my husband ordered cooked to medium. It was well over but thankfully still juicy and delicious.the cinnamon roll was overly indulgent which we had hoped lol, and perfect for sharing between 2 people. My smoked trout and potato latkes was fabulous. Light and refreshing dish, crispy latkes and the creamy smoked trout was a perfect combo. The pickles and radish gave the dish a nice bite.  Service was great and the menu had a lot of interesting dishes I'm anxious to come back and try.

luMTODClVChCgo03RCgGAg.text: Solid Lawrenceville spot with a trendy, clean vibe. Had a cinnamon roll and bacon egg biscuit with coffee. Thought everything was well presented and hearty, but neither of the items really blew me away with flavor. With that said, I'd still come back and try something different. Service was great and coffee was solid.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon &amp; Egg Biscuit Sandwhich. Cinnamon Roll

rjc74ilmGQnXo3Sr0hjCDQ.text: I could have loved The Vandal... if I hadn't been dining with a friend who has Celiac. We popped in for a late breakfast on a weekday. Looking at the menu, it seemed like it would be relatively easy for my friend to find something to eat, with a modification or two. Our server was so kind and helped point out some of the items that might work well. I went for the soft scrambled eggs with a side of bacon while my friend decided on the smoked trout. To make the dish gluten-free, our server suggested subbing fries for the potato latkes (not GF). Done deal!   A few minutes later, our server returned and informed us that the chef was unable (read: unwilling) to swap fries for latkes. Fries are part of the menu (they come with the burger), so it's not like this was a difficult request. My friend would have loved to eat the dish as it came if it wouldn't have made her physically ill.   Our server was doing everything she could to accommodate and she offered a side salad on the house to go with my friend's smoked trout dish. This was such a nice gesture but unfortunately didn't make for a very filling meal for my friend. My plate, on the other hand, was enormous and quite honestly totally delicious.   The Vandal is a great option if you have no dietary restrictions and can order from a menu as-is without changes. Otherwise, I'd highly suggest finding another option, which is a shame because it's a cute spot with very nice servers.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Soft scrambled eggs

IKIwLlyRQQCGQ4Ho7c2UjQ.text: Tried The Vandal for the first time on Saturday night and had a wonderful time! I was able to snag a reservation (for a "standard" table, not just the bar or high top) several days ago for 8:15pm. After seeing the restaurant layout, I was pleased that I was able to get a regular table as it was much more comfortable and intimate as the other options. Service was fantastic. The host was friendly, and our waiter was excellent. Our waiter did a nice job of checking on us and getting excited about the menu's offerings but not being too over the top or overwhelming.   For drinks, I had both the orange wine and sparkling rose. The orange wine was such a fun discovery. I am a huge fan of this hard to find variety so seeing it on the menu was exciting. The sparkling rose was a beautiful wine and one of my favorite sparkling roses that I've ever had.   We started our meal with the Deviled Duck Egg. I love deviled eggs and this egg was the best I've ever had. The yellow of the egg was beautifully smooth in both texture and flavor. It was topped by chicken crackling and trout roe. The crackling was excellent adding both a crispy texture and salty flavor, while the trout roe didn't add much in flavor or in presentation (as the restaurant was a bit too dim to even see the roe delicately placed on top of the crackling).  Next we had a pasta dish recommended by the waiter - the Pappardelle two ways. I enjoyed the onion topping but the dish left a bit to be desired in my opinion, especially as the pasta itself was too al dente for my taste.  We split two entrees - the Vandal Burger and the Lamb Tenderloin. Both were tasty dishes, but in hindsight, were an odd pairing of items to share. The burger was very flavorful and casual and accompanied by a side of fries while the lamb was a much more formal plate.  Finally, for dessert, we settled on the Chocolate Affogato and the Carrot Cake per the recommendation of our waiter. The Chocolate Affogato was way too soft in texture as both the soft chocolate cake and very loose espresso mousse was then doused with an americano sauce. The flavors were some of my favorite (chocolate and coffee) but the execution was poor. Thankfully, the carrot cake was incredible and was really made a home run by the addition of chevre to the icing.  Overall, I had a wonderful evening and enjoyed one of the few date nights that we've had since my daughter was born last year. However, though the service was excellent and several of the dishes were either excellent or good, a couple of the dishes did perform below expectations. I'd love to see The Vandal hitting it out of the park with every dish, and when that occurs, I think you'll see the restaurant climb in both popularity and ratings.

JRmO1QLKjkXEJVenJSzmbQ.text: I've been here once before, and I would say 4/5 stars is the most accurate rating for my overall experience at The Vandal.  [Food] The first time I visited, I ordered a burger. It was honestly perfect. The right balance of hearty and healthy. The food filled me up but not to the point of a bad food coma. I also got a vanilla latte, which I found to be a little too sweet for my liking, but standard in terms of overall quality.  My second visit, I had trouble figuring out what to order because I've recently gone vegan. Fortunately the waitress and chef were generous enough to offer me a vegan pasta dish. Honestly, the pasta was a bit salty, but who am I to complain? The saltiness paired well with my orange juice -- so it was, in a way, a match made in Heaven. The pasta had mushrooms, veggies and a kick of flavor. So thankful for the compensation.  [Atmosphere] If you're into the minimalistic, classy aesthetic, this is the place for you! The windows and white interior allow for insta-worthy picture. Natural light really changes a space.  [Service] The waitress for my first visit wasn't the friendliest, but she did her job well. She was a bit unhappy that my friend and I came in right at opening. I understood but was a  it intimidated to be quite frank.  The waitress for my second visit (I believe her name was Katie) was amazing. She went over the top in terms of welcoming, tailoring to and serving my table. I'd give her an A++!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Freshly squeezed OJ
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan Pasta (not on menu)

LXC51YJrd7pZdqsPx9OkaA.text: I've heard a lot about the vandal over he past few years and was excited to come for my first time. I came on a Sunday at noon and was seated promptly at one of the two window seats. The interior was a lot smaller than I had imagined but it's  consistent and clean decoration made it feel homey. The staff was kind, very polite towards us and other customers as well. I have no complaints there.  I was looking forward most towards tasting their food. I ordered the assorted pastries, which allowed me to choose 3 out of the four or five on the menu. So my boyfriend and I decided on the apple oat muffin, the cinnamon roll, and their doughnut. I wished I could've tried their beignets, seen from other reviews. This plate of pastries came out first. The muffin and cinnamon roll were nothing too special, but I really fell in love with the flavor of the donut. Unfortunately, it had not been baked long enough. The inside was still doughy and I could taste the strong fermentation flavors of the yeast. I was very disappointed.  This disappointment continued as my fried chicken sandwich arrived. The chicken was more tall than it was flat and it made for a very difficult consumption process. Because of the awkward shape, I had trouble holding everything together and taking reasonably sized bites. Furthermore the chicken was dry and tasteless. I didn't even want to finish my sandwich. My boyfriend on the other hand had no problem finishing his cheeseburger.  Overall, I believe the food at the vandal is a hit or miss. The atmosphere is nice and the service is great, but I'd rather be impressed through my tastebuds than by anything else. I'd give it another chance if I knew the right things to order.

Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried chicken sandwich on the left ($11) and cheeseburger on the right ($12)

uaN3UoSfSt90HJCiXmirHg.text: This is the perfect brunch spot. While the prices are a little high, the food is definitely worth it. We got two plates to split and both were incredible.  The restaurant itself is pretty small and service is incredibly fast. They have a wide selection of both breakfast and lunch items, so you'll definitely find something you're in the mood for. I'd 100% recommend the soft scramble- scrambled eggs mixed with ricotta so that they're nice and creamy- and the macaroni and cheese. Both were incredible. Their handmade cafe drinks were also a must-try. This will be your new favorite brunch spot!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Soft Scramble
Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tallegio Mac &amp; Cheese

jSwbv6RS-Wr1eRDoBWjjmQ.text: This place is definitely a one-time only brunch spot. Maybe two if it's not too out of the way for you. The inside is so beautiful, bright, and minimalistic. And the food is good, but sort of on the pricey side.  I came on a weekday right before they opened, so our group was the first one seated. But I have heard from my friends that it can get packed very quickly, and the wait is pretty long since there is not much seating inside for how hyped this place is.  We ordered the scrambled eggs, smoked salmon, and fried chicken sandwich. I was shocked to discover that the scrambled eggs was my favorite dish of the three! They were so fluffy and flavorful - and perfectly seasoned! The other two dishes were also delicious but they didn't really make me say, "wow I NEED to come back for this soon!"   I recommend coming here with a date or some of your girlfriends for a bougie brunch. For the experience!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Scrambled eggs, smoked trout, &amp; fried chicken sandwich

XAf6vRJKqGL2P1EJz3_gww.text: It has been some time since my previous visit to the Vandal and I was delighted to return. Having enjoyed the food at Joey's snacks at Smallman Galley who is one of the principal chefs here I wanted to visit it again. The resident principal chef here now is Csilla T.  The walls are in bad shape with holes drilled into them however, the set up is different than my first visit and the menu has now changed to a more restaurant format. You order at the counter and then they bring your food to you. If you come during the week you are still given a brunch menu which is served typically on weekends but it has breakfast items on it as well. Certain items can be made gluten free and vegan can be accommodated to a limited extent. I had a very nice hostess who told me the concept is now different from the way I knew it and that the food is locally sourced.  Upon her recommendation I ordered the fried chicken sandwich with a layer of carrot slaw on top. If you want an egg on top or a side salad there's a $2.00 upcharge for each item. I went with the side salad since it came with a very light vinagrette dressing on it.  The place was empty so I could virtually sit anywhere. I had my meal fairly fast and I must say that the chicken was tasty and it was a large chicken breast to boot! More bang for your buck here!  The salad, even though it was basic still was full of flavor so I could enjoy it. It was also a bit juicy, but no worries, my server was kind enough to get me a wet napkin to clean my hands. Staff is wonderful here and is willing to help you will all your needs.  The Vandal serves dinner and reservations can be booked on Open Table. They also have cookies you can purchase for take out or dessert and they have both wine and a limited selection of cocktails.   I was glad for the opportunity to enjoy a delicious lunch here and am looking forward to returning to try out their other menu items. Located on Butler St in central Lawrenceville there is a metered parking lot nearby. Eat like a vandal! You'll be glad you did!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vandal - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried chicken sandwich with greens

iPl6oINJqDIUUaisNZdHTA.text: YES MUST GO! We went for brunch. First of all, amazing decor and atmosphere. The food was really great, came out quick... service was good. It's just a super cool restaurant to check out. Absolutely loved all the details.

iwuhNGrJT--oiD6k2Q5mzw.text: I have no idea why I've never written a review here for this place. Most likely because the food is so good I'm too busy tearing into it like a mad woman.  So, you definitely need to do reservations. It's small and quaint and just like me, everyone loves it...so book ahead and save yourself disappointment of not getting in or a crazy long wait.  I've enjoyed brunch a couple of times and the items I've had are as follows (no order really): quiche, pancakes, biscuit sandwich, Bloody Mary and Mimosa. Not all at once of course.  For dinner of course, The Vandal Burger that's made with marrow. Delectable and huge. Usually split it with the boyfriend.  The Vandal continues to be a yum fest. Here, here!

NYZyoiL5YiJBgjeUXRfY0Q.text: Amazing service and fabulous food! Everything was perfect. The place is cozy and welcoming. We loved!

5OXp0Wo5-0YFdtltikU9_Q.text: Probably one of the worst restaurants I've ever had the displeasure of visiting. It seemed that the emphasis was on an artsy use of unique ingredients over taste. It is the only time that my party of five had to immediately go to the Iraqi restaurant next door to get another meal. The only exception was the lemonade we all enjoyed. Definitely not worth the money.

fshsm6Jn_BdoQsQ8nv1k9g.text: Stop. Being. So. Amazing.   Holy crap, the Vandal is the stuff. Honestly, if I could pick one restaurant to eat at for the rest of my life, it would be here. Extraordinary food, beautiful space, amazing staff. What I particularly love is how carefully everything is done here - the flavors just sing with freshness and nothing is overdone. LOVE.

6iTI9GQBURQDfu9vzfAszQ.text: Love, love, love this addition to Lawrenceville!    The restaurant is kind of unique and bears description - you order your food and pick it up at the counter, though the food is the same quality that you'd eat at any of Pittsburgh's fine dining restaurants.  That said, The Vandal is fabulous for breakfast and lunch, but not necessarily the place you'd take a date or go for a special occasion.    The staff is always wonderfully friendly, and I love that the Vandal has fun with themselves (no, not in that way) by doing things like theme nights.

pT8UpZ9YANA6T5iy8lqKfg.text: We love the vandal and I chose it for my birthday today but it was a bit of a letdown.  The chicken sandwich is a classic that no one does better, but the squash soup, while tasty, was unpredictably thin and made up almost entirely of cream.    The fried pickles were inedible.  My resident vinegar lover, who will sprinkle vinegar on things happily, actually gagged at the table.  The pickles are radishes and carrots which I assume are meant to be a pleasant surprise but it was an unwelcome one in our case,especially since they were so hard to bite through it hurt a little.  The server didn't seem to notice that they remained 90% uneaten and didn't ask how the meal was so I let it go.  (He stopped in to check on us right when he delivered them but we hadn't tasted them yet at that point.)  So Vandal, keep up the generally great work but please annex the pickles or serve with a warning.

13C26_jWXfAj3CWzco95tg.text: Absolutely delicious. Went with my girlfriend for dinner and had no regrets. Fast turnover when ordering and really friendly staff.

KKgGk_aF7WjkfkHR0351wg.text: Came here after I saw that a couple of my friends have been here as of late. The decor of the place is quite interesting ... very trendy, very hip ... and has both window seating and small sit-in tables.  Unfortunately, the food ... probably not as up to par. No, I'm not necessarily or merely talking about how the food tasted, because the burger with the tomato mayo was quite delicious (that tomato mayo was especially quite tasty), the mac & cheese was alright (amount of cheese used was sufficient, but I found it to taste overly milky for some strange reason), and the fries were alright, but the price is a bit hard to swallow. Portion size for the mac & cheese appetizer ($4) came in a weeny small tray and that's not even referring to the burger ($11), that of which I could have gotten a bigger one almost anywhere else and most likely for cheaper. The iced coffee was alright ... they also give you squeeze bottles to use before you take it so that you can adjust the levels of milk and sugar to your liking.  So overall impression ... overhyped & underwhelming. Definitely see the potential though. Might give it a try again later down the road after it's had some time to acclimate and grow.

I was here for brunch and the place was hopping. Great vibe, crowd and music. The design of the space is clean and modern. The Vandal is a solid choice for an excellent early day meal experience.

pHKsA8H1tlAzOScjj6RfkA.text: We came here for brunch on a Saturday. I had the burger, which was tasty but not superb. The portion was good. Other dishes look good too, so I probably will come back to try something new next time.
